sub-events.comment:
In order to bring up our Message Window we call the function "ui_msg". It uses Parameters 0 and 1 to pull the Y and Z coordinates respectively from G_DIALOG array with the X coordinate being pulled by the Language setting (g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), tokenized into 9 variables:
token 0 : Pause mode type, 2 will be used for most dialogue, 3 will be unskippable, 4 will be skippable but not clearable, 5 will be both unskippable and unclearable, 6 will be decision dialogue token 1 : >=message window height, -1 = window invisible token 2 : write mode, 0 = typewriter, 1 = instantaneous token 3 : timer toggle token 4 : time text stays on the screen token 5 : portrait animation, typically by character, NULL for invisible token 6 : portrait frame, typically to differentiate emotion token 7 : text alignment, 0 = left, 1 = center, 2 = right token 8 : text to display, this gets sent to the ui_font0 object's "ui_string" variable
Parameter 2 is an optional string added on to the end of the token8_Text string.
Keep in mind, text with the portrait visible can only fit 23 characters per line, and text without the portrait can only fit 30 characters per line. Each message has a 5 line limit.
If the string has %char% in it, replace with the following: %n% Name %i% Item %a% Ammo %eq% Right Quotation Marks

This is the text writing handler. It looks nicer than just instantly displaying the text and altering the speed of the writing allows us to add a little bit more inflection or character to the dialogue.
When ui_font0's "text" finally matches "ui_string" we enable the player to press the Action button in order to progress through the text.
When ui_font0's "timer" finally hits 0 after the text is fully displayed, we clear the message.
If ui_font0's "text" does not match its "ui_string" variable given during the "ui_msg" function, continue to write the text at the rate of the global "TEXT_SPEED".
Finally, when we're done with the dialogue segment we call "ui_msg_clear", because leaving an empty dialogue window is pretty ugly.
MENU Global : -1 = off, 0 = Main Menu, 1 = Journal, 2 = Map, 3 = Item, 4 = Rune, 5 = Equip, 6 = Status, 7 = Save, 8 = Quit, 9 = Continue
When we hit the "Menu" key, or when "MENU" = 0, we open up the main menu.
When we hit the "Item" quick key, or when "MENU" = 2, we open up the item menu.
When we hit the "Rune" quick key, or when "MENU" = 3, we open up the rune menu.
Display Menu Name and indent Menu Icon
Constantly update this because of the clock. Time is read as Hours:Minutes.

action.name: Set text
action.param: g_gamedata.At(0,0,5) & "/" & g_gamedata.At(0,0,6) & newline & g_gamedata.At(0,0,7) & newline & floor(min(99, g_gamedata.At(0,0,4) / 3600)) & ":" & zeropad(floor((g_gamedata.At(0,0,4) % 3600) / 60), 2)

sub-events.comment: As long as the menu selection isn't "Quit"
If "Continue" selected, unpause and exit menu system
If no quests, just forget anything ever happened.
If cursor is highlighting the Active Quest, change the cursor to an X. Else, change the cursor to an Arrow.
Up and down and all around
Update the selected Quest when switching. Always display the latest entry first.
Change the Active Quest. This also updates the objective markers in the Map Menu.
Turn the page, wash your hands.
Show current page / total pages. Also show arrow indicators informing the player if they can go right or left.
If no quests, just forget anything ever happened.
Up and down and all around
Update the selected Quest when switching. Always display the latest entry first.
Turn the page, wash your hands.
Show current page / total pages. Also show arrow indicators informing the player if they can go right or left.
Check to see how many markers need to be put up.
If there's an item, display text. Else, show no text.
Up and down and all around
Check to make sure the item slot isn't empty.
If Item Function = NULL, item unuseable.
If Item Type = 0, change to Instant Use Menu.
If Item Type = 1, change to Party Target Menu.
Up and down and all around
Check to make sure the item slot isn't empty.
Call item function immediately and remove item from inventory. Param(0) = Inventory Index Param(1) = Caster (player)
Up and down and all around
Call item function immediately and remove item from inventory. Param(0) = Inventory Index Param(1) = Caster (player) Param(2) = Target
If there's an item, display text. Else, show no text.
Up and down and all around
Check to make sure the item slot isn't empty.
If Item Function = NULL, item unuseable.
If Item Type = 0, change to Instant Use menu.
If Item Type = 1, change to Party Target menu.
Up and down and all around
Check to make sure the item slot isn't empty.
Call item function immediately and remove item from inventory. Param(0) = Inventory Index Param(1) = Caster (player)
Up and down and all around
If there's an item, display text. Else, show no text.
If Normal Ammo, display Infinite Ammo.
Else, display Ammo Count from Inventory.
Up and down and all around
Check to make sure the item slot isn't empty.
Up and down and all around
Always set the Cursor to the selected rune
Display the Spell Data if we have the Rune

action.name: Set text
action.param: g_runeDB.At(1, g_runeDB.At(0,ui_cursor.ui_index0,1), 0) & newline & newline & g_runeDB.At(1, g_runeDB.At(0,ui_cursor.ui_index0,1), 1)

sub-events.comment: Otherwise leave the Spell Data text blank
Up and down and all around
Check to make sure we have the Rune
If RC is greater than Spell's RC Cost, activate Spell

action.name: Set text
action.param: min(9999999, g_gamedata.At(0,3,0)) & newline & newline & floor(min(99, g_gamedata.At(0,0,4) / 3600)) & ":" & zeropad(floor((g_gamedata.At(0,0,4) % 3600) / 60), 2)

sub-events.comment: If at Full HP, text is green
If less than Max HP but more than 1/3 HP, text is white
If less than 1/3 HP but more than 1/5 HP, text is yellow
If less than 1/5 HP, text is red

action.name: Set text
action.param: min(9999999, g_gamedata.At(0,3,0)) & newline & newline & floor(min(99, g_gamedata.At(0,0,4) / 3600)) & ":" & zeropad(floor((g_gamedata.At(0,0,4) % 3600) / 60), 2)

sub-events.comment: Check for the number of party members to cycle properly.
Default Menu Options: 0 : Controls 1 : Video Mode 2 : Music Volume 3 : SFX Volume 4 : Quit 5 : Continue

action.name: Set text
action.param: g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 9) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 20) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 23) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 24) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 6) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 3)

sub-events.comment: Up and down and all around
Default Menu Options: 0 : Controls 1 : Video Mode 2 : Music Volume 3 : SFX Volume 4 : Quit 5 : Continue
Control Menu Options: 0 : Up 1 : Down 2 : Left 3 : Right 4 : Action 5 : Attack 6 : Satchel 7 : Runecaster 8 : Secondary 9 : Menu 10: Back

action.name: Set text
action.param: g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 10) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 11) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 12) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 13) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 14) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 15) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 16) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 17) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 18) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 19) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 7)

sub-events.comment: Up and down and all around
Control Menu Options: 0-9: Set Control 10: Back
Up and down and all around. Increments of 10.
Up and down and all around. Increments of 10.
Up and down and all around

action.name: Set text
action.param: g_saves.At(loopindex("saveslot"),4) & newline & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 0, 52) & ": " & floor(min(99, g_saves.At(loopindex("saveslot"),6) / 3600)) & ":" & zeropad(floor((g_saves.At(loopindex("saveslot"),6) % 3600) / 60), 2) & newline & g_dialog.At(g_gamedata.At(0,0,6), 1, g_saves.At(loopindex("saveslot"),7))

sub-events.comment: Up and down and all around.
Up and down and all around.

Save Data
0 : Saved? 0 = no, 1 = yes 1 : Party Member 1 2 : Party Member 2 3 : Party Member 3 4 : File Name 5 : ??? 6 : Time 7 : LocationID 8 : Layout 9 : WarpX 10 : WarpY 11 : Music Name
